alert.note: Alert for Rogers (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 09 at 9:47PM CDT until June 10 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT FOR SOUTHWESTERN ROGERS COUNTY... At 947 PM CDT, Trained weather spotters reported flash flooding in the Catoosa area. High water rescues ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tulsa... Catoosa... FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
